summary: This is an email chain between prosecutors discussing a draft prosecution memo regarding a case, likely related to Jeffrey Epstein or an associate. The emails debate legal strategy, specifically the viability of using a 'child endangerment' charge and a perjury charge, and mention coordinating with superiors ('the chiefs').

persons.name: Geoff
persons.context: Mentioned as someone who 'is going to want' the perjury argument included in the prosecution memo, indicating a supervisory or influential role in the legal strategy.

events.title: Prosecution Memo Discussion
events.description: Prosecutors exchange emails to finalize and discuss a draft prosecution memo, debating legal theories including child endangerment and perjury charges.

keyFacts: Prosecutors are debating whether 'child endangerment' is a viable underlying charge for sexual activity, specifically referencing a scenario where a 14-16 year old girl massages the feet of a masturbating grown man.
The legal team is also discussing the strength of a potential perjury charge, noting that some statements will be 'directly contradicted by our witnesses'.
The correspondence indicates internal strategic discussions about charging decisions and case theory before presenting a memo to superiors ('the chiefs').
The document references an underlying lawsuit and the materiality of admissions within it, suggesting a complex legal background to the case.
